sentence.Network_en: I was appal ( l ) ed at the news.
This " Hamlet " will appal some for being so resolutely unclassical.
sentence.Network_cn: 新版《哈姆雷特 》 如此违背经典,确实惊世骇俗.

sentence.Network_en: The new film will ambush the unwary, appal the squeamish and get unwanted attention the prurient.
sentence.Network_cn: 这部新片将出其不意地震撼粗心的观众, 令胆小的观众感到惊骇,并得到好色之徒讨厌的关注.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from Old French apalir 'grow pale', from a- (from Latin ad 'to, at') + palir 'to pale'. The original sense was 'grow pale', later 'make pale', hence 'horrify' (late Middle English )

entry.def: If something appals you, it disgusts you because it seems so bad or unpleasant.

example.ex: My wife now looks like her mother, which appals me.
example.tran: 我老婆现在看着就跟丈母娘似的，可吓人了。

sentences.sentence: "The scandalous behavior of this married woman shocked her friends"

means.word_mean: 2. fill with apprehension or alarm; cause to be unpleasantly surprised;

sentences.sentence: "I was horrified at the thought of being late for my interview"
"The news of the executions horrified us"

auth_sentence.content: Thoughts that awe but not appal.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Thoughts that awe but not appal.

auth_sentence.content: A bold one that dare look on that Which might appal the devil.

means.word_mean: 使惊骇; 使充满恐惧

sentences.en: They were appalled by the reports of the nuclear war.
sentences.cn: 他们被核战争的报道吓坏了。

sentences.en: The enemy was appalled at our attack.
sentences.cn: 敌人被我们的进攻吓得魂飞丧胆。

jushi.english: The number of people killed on the roads appalled the police.
jushi.chinese: 公路上的死亡人数使警方大为震惊。

jushi.english: The thought of someone else driving my car appals me.
jushi.chinese: 想到我的车让别的人来开,真使我不寒而栗。

jushi.english: We were appalled at the prospect to having to miss our holiday.
jushi.chinese: 我们为失去这一假日而感到大失所望。
